title: An old Keen GBC related interview
content:
I just noticed this old article when browsing around. It's an interview by IGN where Palmer ("the man responsible for the Game Boy Color port of Commander Keen") answers their questions (duh).

I was about to post this in unofficial games section only because Keen GBC doesn't deserve the title of an original Keen game. I don't consider it official at all, but posted it only here just because some other mod or admin might move the topic if I placed it elsewhere.

Try not to cry! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

[url=http://gameboy.ign.com/articles/094/094301p1.html]gameboy.ign.com/articles/...301p1.html[/url]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] And here's small caption to stir up your anger:

IGNpocket: How close is the game to the original PC version? What's changed?

Palmer: It is very close to the PC game. There were certain Keen PC titles that we could not use, however the ones we could use, we tried as hard as possible to keep the look and feel of the original game.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

Found some stuff...

[quote]Quote:[hr]Commander Keen is yet another old PC shareware game given new life on handheld systems. Thankfully, several improvements make it seem less of a clone, and the kid-friendly formula is a bit different due to the large free roaming areas and difficulty.[hr][/quote]

Um... 'Improvements'? 'New Life'? How about 'death'? Wouldn't you rather have 'a clone', rather than a cheap cliche GBC platformer that is only CALLED commander keen? And 'A bit different'??? Obviously no one outside the Keen Community has truthfully compared the old and new.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Earth's core has been hit by a strange anomaly that's caused electronic devices all around the world to go crazy, and more importantly, interrupted Billy Blaze's cartoons. Billy, in his Commander Keen persona, must save the world and get the cartoons back on the air. Little does he know that old enemies like Droidiccus, Shikadi and Bloogs have joined forces, stolen three plasma crystals and created the Omegamatic to destroy him and the Earth once and for all. It's up to you to get the crystals back and destroy the machine.[hr][/quote]

Now Keen only cares about cartoons?? Droidicans? Old? Oh, yes, i forgot the popular Episode 5.75, where Keen battles the Droidicans for cancelling his favorite show! And why would the omegamatic only blow up earth? Do the crystals make it weaker?

[quote]Quote:[hr]The three bosses are fairly straightforward, and each has a weakness to exploit. If you get hung up on one, you can take a break and come back later thanks to the password system, but you always start off at the hub. The upside is that you can go through the worlds again to gain more points and extra lives in preparation of facing the boss again.[hr][/quote]

Yeah, that password system is SO advanced. And yet we still use the "save-in-the-middle-of-a-level-and-start-off-where-we-saved" system. We're such losers! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]While the game doesn't bring anything new to the table, and is a bit expansive for the GBC, fans of the original series and younger players will probably get the most enjoyment. The gameplay is very "old school" and definitely gives you a lot of button mashing for your buck, though rental may be the best way to approach it. ~ Jason White, All Game Guide[hr][/quote]

Yeah, us fans REALLY love this one. Old school? Well, it did have the same amount of fun and design as pong. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] -Genius314

[quote]Quote:[hr]In what way is it so different that it is unkeenish?[hr][/quote]

Again, I didn't play this game yet myself, so I can't be too harsh in judging it, but I suppose that could be considered a good thing.
Anyway, from what I understand, all enemies are similar, all can be killed, and all in the same way, by shooting and then pogoing on them.
A big part of Keen (to me) is the diversity of enemies.
Keen is about collecting candy and toys, not some random objects, which I read is what he does in the GBC game.

[quote]Quote:[hr]The GBC Keen is in every way an official Keen game, it's made by people who got the right to use the name Keen and to sell the game.
(...)
It's not part of the official series. Somewhat like Keen Dreams (...)[hr][/quote]

Agree about the official-ness, but not about the series thing. Just like KD, CK GBC is a part of the series... why wouldn't it be?
It's not part of the original trilogy; it has that in common with KD, and with K6 too, since that ended up not being a part of the second trilogy, which therefore wasn't a trilogy anymore either.
Still, it's part of the series, even if I, or anybody else, doesn't like it.

[quote]Quote:[hr]In other words, Tom is right about Keen GBC not being a sequel, nobody would deny that, but it's still an official Keen game.[hr][/quote]

As far as a I know, CK GBC is in fact a sequel.
It follows the other stories chronologically, and it's still a somewhat similar platform game at least.
Of course if it would've been a CK racing game it would still be referred to as a sequel I think.
Then there's the "spiritual sequel", for instance Supreme Commander is the sequel to Total Annihilation.

So, I deny that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
It's just that I don't consider CK GBC canonical, in that I agree fully with Tom Hall.

[quote]Quote:[hr]GBC Keen does?[hr][/quote]

Yep, well... I'm not intimately familiar with the story, but it just doesn't fit in with the other games' stories, basically.
I suppose I can imagine the Bloog and the Shikadi work together... almost, but along with a new robot race?
A new race should probably be introduced alone, like the other games did.
Then there's the enemies like the Badoing (kidnapped by the Shikadi for an unknown reason?) and Cyba-Mallow (mix between a cyborg and a marshmellow made by the Shikadi because they were bored???)
I can understand if Tom doesn't like it if someone else invents that the Shikadi have a ruler that is a big, one-eyed, orange head that apparently shoots rockets, and isn't very Shikadi.

I suppose in the end it's just opinions, but the fact that Tom Hall, the designer of the IP, doesn't like it, is an indication of something.

For instance the Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time trilogy is a very popular one, and it actually is a pretty good translation of the old 2D gameplay, faithfull to the original, but with the right amount of added and, if necesary, changed elements.
I suppose it's likely to be a reboot of the POP universe, as a prequel (as suggested by the creators I think) the original games wouldn't make as much sense.
Where am I going with this anyway???
Never mind, I think I already made my point clearly enough before, agree with it or not. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8

title: Re: An old Keen GBC related interview
content:
"Why isn't the story unkeenish? Only because it's crap?"
It is un-Keenish! Sigh.. Read the other Keen stories and compare. It's un-Keenish, thus it's crap, since this is supposed to be a Commander Keen game and therefore expected to be at least of some decent quality..

"Does Keen really looks so bad compared to those other games? Those graphics are a beauty, the best I've seen on the GBC."
Compared to other GBC graphics, they're very nice. But they aren't Keenish. The style is very different of that seen in the old Keen games. This doesn't feel Keenish somehow. Lacks the olde detail.. Keen doesn't look Keen. Nobody likes his shirt red and his skin brown. He doesn't even look Keen physically. I've seen excellent jobs on Keen sprites in mods. Some people have made an all new Keen sprite that still represents Keen perfectly -- and in about half smaller sprite size than the GBC uses, so it's a shame they couldn't get Keen look Keen even if they have plenty more pixels to use.

"Unkeenish? In what way, only becausee you can kill enemies with a pogo? I agree that it doesn't make the game better but it's not enough."
Enough for me. Controlling the character is horrible, and the physics feel pretty different from those seen in other Keens. Pogoing on a enemy after shooting? That's just so stooopid. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img] And then there is again the different menus and all that stuff..

"I know that's your opinion but I want to know why."
I thought it was clear.. This game differs from the original Keens so much! Graphics, music, level work.. They're all different here. (And not in a good way.) Can you honestly compare this to other Keens and tell this is just as Keenish as any other Keen?

"A lot insults which make you sound like a little child. Come on you can do better."
I am! Many years ago.. I can't do any better! What should I say?

"And of course the main reason for this release was money"
Now that's for sure, and has been said many times before. This game was made just because of money, not because the team loved Keen adventures and wanted to create a new one..

"even Tom Hall doesn't work for free"
I'm fairly sure he would, if he got the rights back..

"You all hate the game so much because you want to hate it not because it's so bad. Instead of whining you could also enjoy it for what it is, at least we got a new Keen game."
That is true, and I could, if it were not so bad.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

"Djas, people hate this game, and you can't convince them otherwise."
At least I got good reasons. And besides, there's such thing as personal opinions.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: An old Keen GBC related interview
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]It is un-Keenish! Sigh.. Read the other Keen stories and compare.[hr][/quote]
I read them all a thousand times. But I'm not one who has to compare them and say this one is crap, it's your contention.

[quote]Quote:[hr]It's un-Keenish, thus it's crap,[hr][/quote]
So un-keenishnes=crap? Or can something still be Keenish and also be crap?

[quote]Quote:[hr]since this is supposed to be a Commander Keen game and therefore expected to be at least of some decent quality..[hr][/quote]
I really can't follow your problem with the story, you still didn't give an explanation. Anyway I find it doubtfull if Keen stands for great storylines. For example I never liked the idea of Mortimer because it was hardly worked out in Keen 3, and the collection idea in Keen 1 is not so much different from GBC Keen.

[quote]Quote:[hr]The style is very different of that seen in the old Keen games.[hr][/quote]
Those games where made for the pc, the GBC has another screen size, another coller palette, etc.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Lacks the olde detail.. [hr][/quote]
That's somewhat true, however it's still one of the most detailed games on the GBC most other games look rather blunt. I don't know why that is, memory isseus maybe? Or doesn't little details work out on a small screen? I'm sure there is a reason for and I don't think Palmer is to blame.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Nobody likes his shirt red and his skin brown.[hr][/quote]
GBC uses another color palette, for the same reason the original Keen has a white skin.

[quote]Quote:[hr]He doesn't even look Keen physically. I've seen excellent jobs on Keen sprites in mods. Some people have made an all new Keen sprite that still represents Keen perfectly -- [hr][/quote]
I'se seen other peoples job on Keen sprites too, and I have to disagree. Xky's Keen (which is a great sprite) shows a smal body with a big head, in the official games Keen is tall and slim, the same goes for the GBC Keen. GBC Keen is therefore more true to the original. Basically what you're now doing it just giving your own interpretation of Keen, everyone has their own and so did the people of Palmer, I don't think that's a strong point.
[quote]Quote:[hr]and in about half smaller sprite size than the GBC uses[hr][/quote]
That's a bit exaggerated...

[quote]Quote:[hr]Controlling the character is horrible and the physics feel pretty different from those seen in other Keens..
[hr][/quote]
You're playing it as a rom on the pc...
[quote]Quote:[hr]And then there is again the different menus and all that stuff.[hr][/quote]
Are you kidding me? Keen 4-6 have the different menu's from Keen 1-3, and so has Keen Dreams. Do you think that if Tom was still making Keen we would still have the same menu's anno 2006?

[quote]Quote:[hr]level work.. [hr][/quote]
That's a new one. Please explain....

[quote]Quote:[hr]Can you honestly compare this to other Keens and tell this is just as Keenish as any other Keen?[hr][/quote]
Not as Keenish but still Keenish.

[quote]Quote:[hr]What should I say?[hr][/quote]
Something different then things like 'he is a bastard, and he only cares for money and he hates us poor Keen fans.' Because you don't know!

[quote]Quote:[hr] not because the team loved Keen adventures and wanted to create a new one..[hr][/quote]
You don't know that. It's like saying that everyone who makes a bad mod/fangame hates Keen.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I'm fairly sure he would, if he got the rights back..
[hr][/quote]
Who knows but I'm sure that back when he started Keen he too wanted to get his wages.-----------------

title: Re: An old Keen GBC related interview
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Name one GBC game where enemies are killed in different ways?[hr][/quote]

I can't, or at least not without doing some serious research. I don't own the console, nor have I played any of the games. I am comparing the game to other Keen games, not other GBC games.

[quote]Quote:[hr]That counts for all good game series, everyone wants some variety. But my previous argument still stands.[hr][/quote]

Well, we agree that all good games need diversity. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] As for your argument, see my reply. I'm looking at the game as a Keen fan, not a GBC player. I understand the GBC is a different platform so the gameplay can't be identical, but if there are too many concessions (is that the right word?) the fans won't be happy.

[quote]Quote:[hr]There are enough candy and toys to be found. Keen gathers random objects in his first adventure too, so I don't know why that's suddenly so bad.[hr][/quote]

The candy and toys make sense, but the addition of other objects doesn't. Keen doesn't gather random stuff in episode 1. The only thing from the top of my head that's a bit out of place is the book. The random items on itself aren't that bad, but along with the rest the overall feel changes.

[quote]Quote:[hr]So I have to repeat my question, why is GBC Keen unkeenish?[hr][/quote]

Let's put it like this, for a big part it's the overal feeling, something that's impossible to accurately describe. If you play poker against someone who wins every single game, even if you play everyday for a year, you can be pretty sure he's cheating, even if you can't prove it, even if it's theoretically possible, just unlikely, that he'll win all those games. It's something in your gut that tells you. Different people have different guts, but for me this game doesn't seem very Keenish, even if I can't properly explain why.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Because of what I said in my previous post but I'll say it once more. GBC is not made by ID but by another companie that borrows the right. It's also released on a consolle while Keen is a pc series. Therefore the game doesn't count as a sequel, it isn't Keen 7, please take a loot at my Duke Nukem example and come with a better one if you disagree.[hr][/quote]

The fact that another company made it doesn't mean it's not part of the series. The later Monkey Island games were made by a different team (though not company, not sure if you make that distinction), but they are still part of the series. If another company were to make a MI adventure, or even a racing game, I think most people would still consider it part of the MI series. I don't think there is an official description for the exact meaning of series; it depends on the context and who you ask. As for the different platform... Duke Nukem Manhattan Project is a part of the DN series even if it's not a PC game.

What about the Sonic series for instance, newer games obviously don't come out on Sega hardware anymore.

Looking at your DN example... I'd have to disagree. Adding a number is one way of indicating games are a part of a series, but definately not the only one.

Think about Street Fighter, a series with a whole bunch of games with and without numbers. Or think Final Fantasy with a screwed up numbering, and usually unrelated stories. Still, the same series.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Now two quotes from you again that you need to explain:
Quote:It follows the other stories chronologically, and it's still a somewhat similar platform game at least.
Quote:Yep, well... I'm not intimately familiar with the story, but it just doesn't fit in with the other games' stories, basically.
Sigh....[hr][/quote]

With the chronological comment I meant that the GBC game follows up the other games story-wise. Also it's a platform game, so in that way it's similar. I'm not sure how else I could word it.

The second quote I really can't word in any other way. The story simply doesn't fit in with the style of the other stories. Again this "style" thing is impossible to explain, at least it is for me. Like I said, I didn't get to play the GBC game myself, nor did I read all of the actual writing in the game, so I can't judge things properly, but the enemy descriptions and overall story publicized on the web gives a pretty good indication alone anyway. I am assuming the sigh was because of the fact that I'm not familiar with the game, but as I said, I know enough for me to feel secure in making an overall judgement.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I don't know I fell asleep half way.[hr][/quote]

Hehe, I don't think you missed much, I seriously forgot, and still don't remember what point I was going to make. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: An old Keen GBC related interview
content:
Exactly. It's pretty difficult to try to explain it.
As Ret8 pointed out, we are looking the game as Keen fans, not typical GBC players.

Anyways, to answer Djaser, which I have been too lazy to do until now.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]


"I read them all a thousand times. But I'm not one who has to compare them and say this one is crap, it's your contention."

Sigh, well, let's see. First of all, as the stories clearly aren't written by someone who used to write them (Tom Hall most probably), the style is so different.
By the way, I know none terms for talking about writings or literature so pardon me.

The story is boring. There happens nothing fun or stuff like in the originals (Keen stunning his parents, Bloogs capturing his baby sitter and leaving a message).
"It's a normal morning for Billy Blaze. Half awake, he gets his cereal and sits in front of the TV, switches it on, and watches... static..." is the worst start for a story ever!

Compare it to the stories of other Keen games. The other stories in Keen 1-3 and Dreams explain briefly who is Commander Keen and then continue, keeping reader interested from the first words to the last. Here, on the other hand, the story couldn't interest player the least, and there's nothing fun or imagineous (may not be a word) in it. Nor there was there any reference to the surrounding Keeniverse nor any humour. Compare it to these first lines of Keen 4 story: "After delivering a crippling blow to the plans of Mortimer McMire and recieving the praise of the Vorticon race Commander Keen returns to his home in the suburbs.
Here he was forced to go to bed at an early hour, and to eat mashed potatoes." [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] See?

Keen GBC story is just dry. It could be a lot better if it started for example this way (I'm not saying that I'm good story maker), although a good story wouldn't save otherwise crappy game: "Billy Blaze, 8-year old genius and intergalactic adventurer, woke up to what seemed just another peaceful day in the suburbs. Billy helped himself to a bowl of tasty Sugar Stoopies and turned on the TV to catch the morning news. Bad news for those wanting to see the news: there was nothing but static!"
Although, I would've made completely different story and not made Keen to watch TV or anything like that. I wouldn't use anything 'subspace anomaly' in my story. Keen wouldn't need to look at his ComputerWrist in order to realize that something's wrong -- besides, what did he see in CW? Keen GBC story doesn't tell.

The story doesn't sound believable at all. I'm surprised they didn't use vorticons in the story. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] Why would the intelligent Shikadi (at least they seem intelligent to me, and I think Mortimer just says everything is dump) suddenly co-operate with dump Bloogs? And even if Mortimer is behind it (as he is), he wouldn't be so stupid to use the same creatures to do his bidding that once failed. And, WHY would they capture creatures from Gnosticus IV (that isn't even mentioned in the story)?!

The story doesn't explain anything, it just says there are some three powerful plasma crystals (ah, that makes a lot sense) that only Keen has power to re-unite the crystals. WTG? First they said the enemies created three crystals and suddenly we hear the crystals should be united for whatever the reason.
And even his old arch-nemesis may have something to do with it.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Yeah, as if Mortimer had already finished his plans to destroy the Universe.

Not to mention the use of words in the story is poor and clumsy, and it's pretty annoying to read "Commander Keen(tm)" everywhere. Fucl you iD!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] This story is a boring description how Keen goes to planet, it really doesn't offer any interesting story line. (Obviously this game was just done and then the team just whipped up some story.)

Anyways, I could complain a lot more but I'm too hungry for that. Haven't eaten a meal for two days. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]


"So un-keenishnes=crap? Or can something still be Keenish and also be crap?"

Not always, but I thought you might have understood I meant that un-Keenishness is really bad in the context of Keen game.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] Yes, an un-Keenish Keen game is crap.
And yes, some Keenish stuff may be crap too.


"Anyway I find it doubtfull if Keen stands for great storylines. For example I never liked the idea of Mortimer because it was hardly worked out in Keen 3, and the collection idea in Keen 1 is not so much different from GBC Keen."

Well, in my opinion the other story lines are great. In Keen 1 Keen is just exploring the mountains of Mars, and while he is away vorticons steal vital parts from his B-w-B Megarocket. Naturally we don't know yet that someone is actually controlling the vorticons. That is revealed as the story proceeds in the following games. Keen stories are really well done in my opinion, and have left things for the player to realize/find out. Best example of this is the letter in the end of Keen 5 -- instead of making Mortimer appear on some screen and saying the content of the letter they decided to write it in SGA and leave it for the player to decipher. Excellent work in my opinion.


"Those games where made for the pc, the GBC has another screen size, another coller palette, etc."

The screen size is different, yeah, but it's capable of showing 56 colours (and choose them from a palette of 32768 colours) at once so using white and pink could've been possible.


"That's somewhat true, however it's still one of the most detailed games on the GBC most other games look rather blunt. I don't know why that is, memory isseus maybe? Or doesn't little details work out on a small screen? I'm sure there is a reason for and I don't think Palmer is to blame."

I think it's just their style. Drawing a tile containing only pixels of one colour should take exactly the same effor than drawing a tile containing many colors. The same goes for storing them in the memory. (Unless they are using some really bizarre ways for both.) And if I remember correct GBC is faster than the olde 286.


"GBC uses another color palette, for the same reason the original Keen has a white skin."

Yes, in this game, but they could have used different colours -- for example those used in the original games. See my reply somewhere above.


"I'se seen other peoples job on Keen sprites too, and I have to disagree. Xky's Keen (which is a great sprite) shows a smal body with a big head, in the official games Keen is tall and slim, the same goes for the GBC Keen. GBC Keen is therefore more true to the original. Basically what you're now doing it just giving your own interpretation of Keen, everyone has their own and so did the people of Palmer, I don't think that's a strong point."

You may be right, probably I'm thinking of something ideal Keen, however, I can't actually define what makes Keen sprites Keen. There are many different Keen sprites (some with bigger head than others) and they still are Keenish to me. So, can't say it being only some physical properties that make the character Keen. However, in my opinion this GBC character lacks something Keenish, and thus doesn't look like Keen to me. And it's not only the distorted colours of GBC sprite. Dunno.
And, can't say Keen GBC being any truer to the original. Keen 1-3 and Keen 4-6 sprites are very different. There must be something wrong in the GBC sprite as many Keeners think it doesn't look Keen.


"You're playing it as a rom on the pc..."

Yes, but can't imagine it being any better on the actual console.


"Are you kidding me? Keen 4-6 have the different menu's from Keen 1-3, and so has Keen Dreams. Do you think that if Tom was still making Keen we would still have the same menu's anno 2006?"

Yes, they vary in the originals as well, but navigation feels different and isn't as good in this one and the password system is really annoying, and slow to use (I guess there's no way to save game to any memory card on such on GBC).


"That's a new one. Please explain...."
Well, the levels too were overall a lot different to those seen in the official ones. I can remember seeing hardly any solid walls. Were there any secret passages? Maybe I should try it again in some distant future.


"Something different then things like 'he is a bastard, and he only cares for money and he hates us poor Keen fans.' Because you don't know!"

I don't think he (necessarily) hates us. But everything in my mind points towards the conclusion that this game is made just for money and nothing else. As said in that interview the guy would've wanted Doom or Quake, but had never dreamed of making a Keen game.


"You don't know that. It's like saying that everyone who makes a bad mod/fangame hates Keen."

I don't. (See above.)


"Who knows but I'm sure that back when he started Keen he too wanted to get his wages."

Yes, probably he wanted to earn money too, who wouldn't? It is his job, of course he has to earn money from it to pay his apartment, food, and such. But money never was (and still isn't) his reason to work on games. It's just a reward and not his goal. Anyways, you've probably read how they worked non-stop, eagerly making a revolutionary game and got pizza money sent to them so they could have something to eat, etc.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Oh man, how I would love a pizza right now.. I really don't have money to spend to even get food every day! Ah.. I'm surely going to buy a pizza once I get home.. Kebab meat, pepperoni, pineaple.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
